Subjective: Constipation x 3 months. Hard stools, difficult to pass. Straining. No bowel movement for 2-3 days at a time. Abdominal cramps, worse with pressure. Bloating, abdomen more swollen than usual. Appetite poor, eats little, has always been this way. No change in eating/drinking habits. Underweight, stable weight. No blood in stool. Tried olive oil, temporarily softens stool. No family history of similar bowel issues, sister has ulcerative colitis but different symptoms. No urinary changes. Menstrual periods regular, started later in life. Request: Concern about seriousness, wants to know what to do, wants softer stools.
Objective: Abdomen: Normal bowel sounds. Tympany on percussion, some dullness on percussion lower left. Tender to palpation lower left. No tenderness on palpation upper abdomen or right lower quadrant. No CVA tenderness. No visible distension.
Assessment: Constipation, likely functional/IBS-C. No alarm symptoms identified. Underweight status to be addressed.
Plan:
1. Psyllium fiber sachets: Prescribed, daily for 6 weeks. Take with plenty of water. 
2. Dietitian referral: Discuss at next appointment. 
3. Safety netting: Return sooner if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or significant blood in stool. 
4. Follow-up: In 6 weeks to assess response to treatment.
